It is a (tiny) breaking change, but I'm curious to see if it unlocks some optimisations for single-threaded executors.

title: Digital Humanities-Vortrag: Git: Was ist das und wie geht das? (27.3.)

last_post.content:
Für viele Digital Humanists ist #git selbstverständliches Tool der täglichen Arbeit. Das gilt aber nicht unbedingt für die oft beteiligten oder angrenzenden Disziplinen und Institutionen oder auch für Studierende.

Wer noch nie so recht Zugang zu git im akademischen Kontext finden konnte oder einfach mal eine Einführung dazu haben möchte, kann sich gern für den Vortrag von Jan Maas (UB Oldenburg) am 27.3. anmelden:

title: Who created the idea(s) of the first loop constructs?

last_post.content:
**Thoughts**

1) Laffy Taffy made an intriguing business decision putting their jokes on the *outside* of the wrapper. One can simply read their joke IP prior to purchasing the candy. Not seeing any discussion of this in the academic literature. Academia asleep at the wheel?

2) I watched a video suggesting that FORTRAN implemented the first loop construct. Turns out that is very wrong! Here is an interesting article on the topic. https://softwareengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/149465/who-created-the-ideas-of-the-first-loop-constructs

title: Have Research Insights Collecting Dust? Here's How to Activate Them

last_post.content:
8 ideas to activate insights and make real impact with your research (https://dscout.com/people-nerds/activate-research-insights) + a gdoc ideation workshop template to help you get started
- Involve stakeholders in the research
- Use video clips in reports
- Run debriefs
- Hold mini brainstorming sessions
- Make space for project Q&As
- Share How Might We (HMW) statements
- Facilitate ideation workshops
- Offer internal insight hackathons

#UserResearch #ResearchInsight #StakeholderManagement

title: Stealthy UEFI malware bypassing Secure Boot enabled by unpatchable Windows flaw

last_post.content:
The recently dubbed 'BlackLotus' malware is particularly impressive. Frankly next level hellseed. A UEFI bootkit that completely bypasses SecureBoot, self-signs against non-OS components, shims its way into the bootloader and then onto persistence in the target OS.

Note that it's built to worm its way into other OSs on same physical machine (dual-boot systems, hypervisors like Parallels on Macs)

Exploits CVE-2022-21894, in all supported versions of Windows.

https://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2023/03/unkillable-uefi-malware-bypassing-secure-boot-enabled-by-unpatchable-windows-flaw/

title: A Little Lull, A Night Train, A Fresh Perspective

last_post.content:
Just published my latest newsletter with:

- @loudnumbers featured in in a scientific paper
- a portfolio update
- an astronomical photo composite
- a map of European night trains
- a system for creating a virtual office for remote workers
- why LLMs aren't oracles but maps
- the results of the first controlled experiments on LLM use

title: http://hf.co/ethics

last_post.content:
Benchmarking in AI is fraught with issues, including disconnects between a dataset's construction and the tasks it's meant to represent, and poor representations of real-world constructs & use cases. Join the discussion on March 13th, 9:00am PT, with
@nima @Leif @borhane!

Learn more at http://hf.co/ethics

title: Stochastic Parrots Day

last_post.content:
Join us on March 17th for Stochastic Parrots Day marking the 2nd anniversary of the paper. The authors will be joined by scientists, teachers, writers, artists, legal scholars & data workers to discuss the large language model landscape.
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/stochastic-parrots-day-tickets-524219965027

Here's the agenda of the event
with Angelina McMillan-Major, @meg @emilymbender with @timnitGebru @milamiceli @asme @Riedl @safiyanoble @nanjala Steven Zapata, Sarah Andrew, Belzie Mont-Louis and an anonymous data worker.

title: Tech Won’t Save Us

last_post.content:

title: We read the paper that forced Timnit Gebru out of Google. Here’s what it says.

last_post.content:
This was a dig at the #StochasticParrots paper, a comprehensive, measured roundup of criticisms of AI that led Google to fire @timnitGebru, a respected AI researcher, for having the audacity to point out the Emperor's New Clothes:

title: Hosting your own Mastodon server

last_post.content:
Want to have complete control and host your own Mastodon server?

I learned a lot about how to host my own Mastodon server, migrate my account and everything that entailed, so I wrote the most comprehensive guide on hosting Mastodon yourself:

https://paulstamatiou.com/hosting-your-own-mastodon-server/

In it I show two ways to host your own server (using a fully-managed Mastodon host, and using a VPS provider). I go into everything from scripts to backup your database and run media clean up tasks, to advanced settings to optimize your server.

I also talk about what to do when things go wrong, and what to expect when first running your new server. If you enjoy this, please share, this one took two months to write.
